question_one.text: What is the purpose of the document and what risks does it aim to address?

answers.text: The purpose of the document is to provide information mandated by North Carolina State law for the protection of the patient. The patient is asked to sign the last page of the document to verify that they have read it and consent to treatment. The document also includes Dr. Tanis' Professional Disclosure Statement, which the patient is required to read and sign. The document aims to address the risks that the patient may face as a result of being in therapy, which the therapist has tried to anticipate. The document also informs the patient that Dr. Tanis is mandated by law to breach confidentiality if certain conditions are met, such as if the patient is threatening self-harm or suicide, threatening to harm another or homicide, or if a child or vulnerable adult has been or is being abused. Additionally, the document states that communications between the patient and therapist are considered privileged in a federal court. Finally, the document informs the patient that Dr. Tanis follows the Code of Ethics for certain organizations.

The purpose of the document is to provide information to clients seeking therapy with Dr. Mike Tanis, LMFT, NCC. The document aims to anticipate the risks that clients may face as a result of being in therapy. It also provides information on Dr. Tanis' contact information, office hours, and appointment policies. The document includes information on Dr. Tanis' qualifications and areas of expertise, as well as his fees and payment policies. The document also addresses ethical considerations, such as confidentiality and informed consent. The document aims to address the risks associated with therapy, such as the potential for discomfort or painful emotions, and provides information on how to terminate therapy if desired.

The purpose of the document is to provide information about Dr. Mike Tanis' professional background, services, fees, ethics, and confidentiality policies, as well as to obtain informed consent for treatment from clients. The document aims to address the risks clients may face during therapy, such as uneasiness or painful emotions that may occur while discussing sensitive issues. It also outlines the circumstances under which confidentiality may be breached, as mandated by law.

This document is mandated by North Carolina State law and is provided for the protection of the client. It aims to anticipate the risks the client may face as a result of being in therapy, such as discussing painful issues which may create discomfort, and the possibility of treatment not being successful. Additionally, it outlines the contact information, personal information, services, fees, ethics, informed consent, diagnoses, and code of ethics of Dr. Mike Tanis, LMFT, NCC.END_ANSWER

question_two.text: What is the fee for each therapy session and what are the consequences of cancelling an appointment?

answers.text: The fee for each therapy session is $125.00 and is to be paid at the beginning of each session. If an appointment is cancelled less than 24 hours prior to the scheduled time, the client will be charged $75.00 for the time reserved for them. It is the client's responsibility to reschedule any missed or cancelled appointments. If Dr. Tanis is subpoenaed to court, Tanis Counseling Services charges $250.00 per hour, which includes time spent in preparation for court appearance, time in discussing court related issues with attorneys or others involved in the court case, and the time spent from when he leaves the office until he returns to the office. This fee is not covered by insurance. Additionally, it is important to note that the information shared in therapy can be subpoenaed through a court order.

The fee for each therapy session is $125.00 and is to be paid at the beginning of each session. If an appointment is cancelled less than 24 hours prior to the scheduled time, the client will be charged $75.00 for the time reserved for them.

The fee for each therapy session is $125.00. Appointments can be cancelled up to 24 hours prior to the scheduled time without penalty. However, if an appointment is cancelled later than 24 hours before the scheduled time, a charge of $75.00 will be applied. It is the client's responsibility to reschedule any missed or cancelled appointments.

The fee for each session is **$125.00**. If an appointment is successfully cancelled as late as 24 hours prior to the scheduled time, there are no consequences; however, if the appointment is cancelled later than 24 hours prior to the scheduled time, the client will be charged **$75.00** for the time reserved for them.END_ANSWER

question_three.text: What theoretical approaches does Dr. Mike Tanis use in his therapy sessions and what is his educational background?

answers.text: Dr. Mike Tanis, a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT) in North Carolina, uses a variety of theoretical approaches in his therapy sessions, including Person-Centered therapy, Cognitive-Behavioral, EMDR, Emotional Focused Couples therapy, and Jungian Psychology. Dr. Tanis received his Bachelor’s Degree (Human Services) from Wingate University, his Master’s Degree (Community & Agency Counseling) from Winthrop University, his Educational Specialist Degree (Marriage & Family Therapy) from Converse College, pursued graduate studies in Play Therapy from UNC-Charlotte, and completed his Post-Graduate clinical residency at WestGate Training & Consultation Network in Spartanburg, SC. Dr. Tanis also pursued graduate studies in Sex Therapy through Psychological Studies Institute and received his doctoral degree, Doctor of Ministry in Family Therapy at Amridge University.

Dr. Mike Tanis, a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT) in North Carolina, uses a theoretically based approach in Person-Centered therapy, Cognitive-Behavioral, EMDR, Emotional Focused Couples therapy, and Jungian Psychology as a core integration of his therapeutic approach. Dr. Tanis received his Bachelor’s Degree (Human Services) from Wingate University, his Master’s Degree (Community & Agency Counseling) from Winthrop University, his Educational Specialist Degree (Marriage & Family Therapy) from Converse College and pursued graduate studies in Play Therapy from UNC-Charlotte. Dr. Tanis completed his Post-Graduate clinical residency at WestGate Training & Consultation Network in Spartanburg, SC. Dr. Tanis also pursued graduate studies in Sex Therapy through Psychological Studies Institute. Dr. Tanis received his doctoral degree, Doctor of Ministry in Family Therapy at Amridge University.

His educational background includes a Bachelor's Degree in Human Services from Wingate University, a Master's Degree in Community & Agency Counseling from Winthrop University, an Educational Specialist Degree in Marriage & Family Therapy from Converse College, and graduate studies in Play Therapy from UNC-Charlotte. Dr. Tanis also pursued graduate studies in Sex Therapy through Psychological Studies Instituteand received his Doctor of Ministry in Family Therapy from Amridge University.

He completed his Post-Graduate clinical residency at WestGate Training & Consultation Network in Spartanburg, SC and pursued graduate studies in Sex Therapy through Psychological Studies Institute. He received his doctoral degree, Doctor of Ministry in Family Therapy at Amridge University.END_ANSWER
